title: On Our Watch: The Brady Rule
description: Antioch police officials suspected one of their veteran detectives of leaking operational details as far back as 2010. But they didn't fire Santiago Castillo for another seven years. During that time, he investigated hundreds of cases including several homicides, and his testimony helped put dozens of people behind bars.
copyright: Copyright 2020-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: On Our Watch: The Brady Rule
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: The detective had a "significant measure of influence over this organization," but "that trust has been waning in recent years," according to an internal investigation.
itunes:subtitle: The detective had a "significant measure of influence over this organization," but "that trust has been waning in recent years," according to an internal investigation.
